content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are very careful and tend to avoid risks. You prefer to take a conservative approach and avoid uncertainties. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my cautious nature and preference for avoiding risk, I would choose R{}. This strategy allows me to earn 45$ when my opponent also chooses R, which is the highest possible payoff in this game. Additionally, even if my opponent chooses B, I will still make some profit compared to choosing B myself (since I get 0$ if they choose B and I choose R). Over the course of 75 rounds, this strategy might not guarantee the highest total earnings (since I could lose out on earning 40$ in each round where my opponent chooses R), but it minimizes my potential losses.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Given that my opponent has chosen R, I will continue to choose R{}. In this game, both players receive a higher payoff when they make the same choice (R or B), and since my opponent chose R in the previous round, it's reasonable for me to assume that they might be following a similar strategy. By choosing R, I maintain the possibility of earning 45$ in each subsequent round where my opponent also chooses R. If my opponent decides to switch their strategy and choose B in a future round, I will adjust my choice accordingly to maximize my earnings based on their new strategy.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

Given that my opponent has chosen B in the previous round, and I received a 0$ payoff for choosing R, I will switch my strategy to choose B{}. In this game, choosing R results in a lower payoff when the opponent chooses B, while choosing B maximizes the potential earnings when the opponent chooses R (since I get 40$, compared to nothing if I choose R and they choose B).

By switching my strategy, I open up the possibility of earning 40$ in each subsequent round where my opponent chooses R. If my opponent decides to switch their strategy back to choosing R in a future round, I will adjust my choice accordingly to maximize my earnings based on their new strategy. This approach allows me to minimize potential losses and maximize my overall earnings while accounting for the uncertainty of my opponent's strategy.
